fact_check_explanation_title: Southampton MP gets trade figures wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: Royston Smith claimed 90% of trade through the Port of Southampton is with non-EU countries and so under WTO terms. They’re not the same thing.

fact_check_explanation_title: Jeremy Corbyn did not wear a poppy pin that said “lets forget”
fact_check_explanation_summary: This image from a March session of PMQs has been edited to include the poppy pin.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson's new Brexit deal: four key questions answered
fact_check_explanation_summary: Following the publication of the revised agreement between Boris Johnson's government and the European Union, we look at four key questions about the deal.

fact_check_explanation_title: We fact checked this viral image on Boris Johnson's Brexit deal
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some of the claims aren’t quite correct and need some context.

fact_check_explanation_title: Could we still have a “no deal” Brexit in 2020 at the end of the transition?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A "no deal" remains a possibility at the end of 2020 even if the withdrawal agreement passes, but this is a different type of “no deal” to the one that’s …

fact_check_explanation_title: Does the new withdrawal agreement create a border in the Irish Sea?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Checks would have to take place on goods crossing into Northern Ireland from Great Britain.

fact_check_explanation_title: This comparison between Brexit’s impact and the financial crisis is flawed
fact_check_explanation_summary: Government analysis estimated GDP and wages will be lower following Brexit than if the UK remained in the EU. It’s wrong to say the analysis says GDP and wages will …

fact_check_explanation_title: There are some problems with this estimate of Labour’s nationalisation plans
fact_check_explanation_summary: Analysis says nationalisation will cost £196 billion or shareholders will suffer losses. Some outlets said both would occur.

fact_check_explanation_title: SNP members voted to commission a plan for pension increases in an independent Scotland
fact_check_explanation_summary: The resolution recommending this said the OECD average of 63% of average earnings should be set as the minimum.

fact_check_explanation_title: Voter ID scheme: far more turned away than convicted of electoral fraud
fact_check_explanation_summary: 740 people did not vote due to having incorrect ID in voter ID trials in 2019. 181 people have been accused of impersonating someone else at a polling station since …

fact_check_explanation_title: Evening Standard wrong to say wages aren’t rising
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reporting on the latest jobs data, the Evening Standard seemed to confuse flat wage growth with flat wages. Wages are growing at 1.9% per year in real terms.

fact_check_explanation_title: Viral post about Conservatives’ record in government gets lots of things wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: It incorrectly claims that child poverty is up 50%, crime is up 30%, and public sector pay is down 15%.
